name: Scorpion (J & F Publishing)
overview: Scorpion is a solitaire variant. If was developed by Maurice Jackson and published in Loadstar #179 in 1999. A "Choose your interface" solitaire game that would be a royal hassle if you had to deal out real cards. Scorpion is one of those games in which piles can grow almost without limit. If you were to have to actually handle these cards it would be an onerous task. Although all suits are to be built in the tableau, this is at its essence a 'build to the foundation' type game. Most games have a 10% win rate and there is considerable chance for strategy.
